availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew B. Clark (Kentucky farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Kentucky farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Quintillia Clark. Father of Sarah W. Clark, Joshua B. Atkinson Clark, Eudora Clark, Winfield S. Clark, Jennette Clark, Charles M. Clark, Mary Jane Clark, William C. Clark, Susan Clark, and John C. Clark. Farmer in Christian County in 1850 and 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Justice of the peace in Muhlenberg County in 1863.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 443; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 12; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 1; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Court House Precinct 3, p. 55; KYR-0001-029-0506.
